intro: Scaligeria scariosibracteata, commonly known as the scarious bract scaligeria, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
